ABOLISH.Defintion: to end an activity or custom officially

AGGRAVATES.Defintion: to make a bad situation worse

AMPUTATIONS.Defintion: cutting off of part of the body

ARCHRIVAL.Defintion: the chief rival of a person, team, or group

BALANCE OF POWER.Defintion: a position in which both or all of the groups or people involved, usually in a political situation, have equal power

BARBARITY.Defintion: behaviour that is very cruel, or a very cruel act

BOOTS ON THE GROUND.Defintion: soldiers, police, etc. who are physically present somewhere in a military or police operation

BURQAS.Defintion: a piece of clothing that covers the whole head and body, with a hole for the eyes, worn by some Muslim women

CHAUVINISTIC.Defintion: believing that or behaving as if women are naturally less important, intelligent, or able than men

CONDONE.Defintion: to accept or allow behaviour that is wrong

CONVICTED.Defintion: having officially been found guilty of a crime in a law court

CYNICAL.Defintion: believing that people are only interested in themselves and are not sincere

DIVERTED.Defintion: to cause something or someone to change direction

EMERGE.Defintion: to come to the end of a difficult period or experience

EMERGED.Defintion: come at the end of a difficult period or experience

ENDORSEMENT.Defintion: the act of saying that you approve of or support something or someone

ENFORCED.Defintion: to make people obey a law, or to make a particular situation happen or be accepted

ENGAGE WITH.Defintion: deal with something, take part in something

ENLIGHTENING.Defintion: giving you more information about something

ESTABLISH.Defintion: to start a company or organisation that will continue for a long time

ETHNIC.Defintion: relating to a particular race of people

EXTRACT.Defintion: to remove or take out something

FRAUGHT.Defintion: full of unpleasant things such as problems or dangers

FRINGE.Defintion: the outer or less important part of an area, group, or activity

FROM THE SIDELINES.Defintion: If you are on the sidelines or do something from the sidelines, you are not actively involved in something

GRAPPLING.Defintion: to fight, especially in order to win something

HARBOURED.Defintion: to protect someone or something bad, especially by hiding that person or thing when the police are looking for him, her, or it

INHUMANE.Defintion: cruel and causing suffering to people or animals

IRONY.Defintion: a situation in which something which was intended to have a particular result has the opposite or a very different result

LONG STORY SHORT.Defintion: used when you do not tell all the details

LUCRATIVE.Defintion: (especially of a business, job, or activity) producing a lot of money

LURKING.Defintion: a lurking person or animal is waiting where he, she, or it cannot be seen, usually waiting to attack or do something bad

MADRASSAS.Defintion: schools where people go to learn about the religion of Islam

MIDDLE AGES.Defintion: a period in European history, between about AD 1000 and AD 1500, when the power of kings, people of high rank, and the Christian Church was strong

MISMANAGEMENT.Defintion: the process of organising or controlling something badly

MUJAHEDDIN.Defintion: fundamentalist Muslim guerrillas; in Afghanistan in 1992 the mujaheddin overthrew the government but were unable to agree on a constitution due to factional conflict and in 1996 Taliban forces seized power

OPIUM.Defintion: a drug made from the seeds of a poppy (= redflower) that is used to control pain or to help people sleep . It can make a person who takes it want more of it and is sometimes used by people as an illegal drug for pleasure

PROPOSITION.Defintion: an offer or suggestion, usually in business

PROXY.Defintion: authority given to a person to act for someone else, such as by voting for them in an election, or the person who this authority is given to

REGAINING.Defintion: to take or get possession of something again

REPORTEDLY.Defintion: according to what many people say

RIVALRIES.Defintion: a situation in which people, businesses, etc. compete with each other for the same thing

ROCKET LAUNCHERS.Defintion: weapons used to fire rockets into the sky

SEEN THE LIGHT.Defintion: If you see the light, you suddenly understand something you didn't understand before

SEIZE.Defintion: to take something quickly and keep or hold it

SHARIAH LAW.Defintion: a religious law forming part of the Islamic tradition. It is derived from the religious precepts of Islam, particularly the Quran and the hadith

SIDELINE.Defintion: something on the periphery, not a mainstream thing

SKEPTICS.Defintion: a person who doubts the truth or value of an idea or belief

STABILITY.Defintion: a situation in which something is not likely to move or change

STAMPING OUT.Defintion: to get rid of something that is wrong or harmful

STRINGS ATTACHED.Defintion: If something such as an agreement has strings attached, it involves special demands or limits

TERRAIN.Defintion: an area of land, when considering its natural features

THROWBACK.Defintion: a person or thing that is similar to an earlier type

TOLERATED.Defintion: to accept behaviour and beliefs that are different from your own, although you might not agree with or approve of them

TRICKY.Defintion: If a piece of work or problem is tricky, it is difficult to deal with and needs careful attention or skill

UNIVERSAL SUFFRAGE.Defintion: the right for everyone to vote
